title: Understanding Records and Fields
text: In a database, a record is a collection of related data items, while a field is a single piece of data within a record.

hintAnswer: data related to persons or items
title: Identifying Records
text: A record typically represents a single entity, such as a person or an item. Can you identify what a record might contain?
choices: data related to persons or items
data items making up a record
certain fields that are required to be filled

hintAnswer: data items making up a record
title: Identifying Fields
text: Fields are the individual data items that make up a record. Can you identify what a field might be?
choices: data related to persons or items
data items making up a record
certain fields that are required to be filled

title: Difference Between Records and Fields
text: Remember, records are collections of fields. Each field contains a single piece of data, while a record is a complete set of fields related to one entity.
